channel.title: Blogs on Jordi Smit
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Jordi Smit

item.title: What does it take to add Copilot to Obsidian?
item.description: Ever since I got access to GitHub Copilot, I have been truly amazed by its capabilities. It continuously keeps feeding me possible completions for my code and text.

item.title: What does it take to let ChatGPT manage my Todoist tasks?
item.description: I have always been fascinated with the idea of AI-based assistants like Jarvis and Friday. Recently, this fascination was rekindled when I read about the Baby AGI project.

item.title: Practicing your DBT skills locally with DuckDB
item.description: After you follow one of the main excellent DBT courses, it’s time to start practicing. However, there is one problem: you now need access to a data warehouse to run your DBT models, but you don’t have access to one.

item.title: The Surprising Impact of Kedro's' Data Catalog
item.description: I recently discovered Kedro, a Python data engineering and science framework. When I played with it, I discovered it is built around some interesting design choices.

item.title: Adding Application Insight Based Monitoring to Fast API
item.description: Application Insights is Azure’s logging and monitoring service, but how do you use it with Fast API? In this blog post, we will explore how to send logs and traces to Application Insights.

item.title: DIY auto-grad Engine: A Step-by-Step Guide to Calculating Derivatives Automatically
item.description: Have you ever marveled at the magic of PyTorch, Jax, and Tensorflow’s auto-grad engines? I know I have! I recently decided to take on the challenge of implementing an auto-grad engine from scratch in Python.

item.title: Python Dataclass From Scratch
item.description: Python’s data class functionality has become very popular over the last few years. Simply adding the @dataclasses.dataclass decorator on top of your class generates a __init__ function, __repr__ function, etc.

item.title: How to call a shell script using a custom keyboard shortcut in MacOS
item.description: Shell scripts and commands are a programmer’s superpower. They allow you to automate repetitive tasks and can make you 10x more productive.
